What is the significance of the percolation threshold calculated to be x = 0.311 in the context of the material's magnetic properties?
data.answer: It indicates the concentration of Ni(II) ions at which a single cluster spans the lattice, affecting long-range magnetic order.

What is the effect of isotropic Zn(II) ion substitution on the anisotropic lattice strain in the material?
data.answer: It causes an anisotropic lattice expansion within the MN4 plane, affecting the material's magnetic anisotropy.

What does the increase in the axial magnetic anisotropy (D) from 13.3(1) K to 16.2(2) K indicate?
